   Bike Austin
   stated on June 8, 2016 in a press release:
   "Bike lanes and sidewalks have been proven to reduce crashes by up to 38
   percent on Austin’s streets."

(Photo
   by W. Gardner Selby)

   By Jane Wester July 29, 2016

Bike Austin says bike lanes, sidewalks reduce Austin crashes up to 38 percent

   CLARIFICATION, 3:46 p.m., Sept. 9, 2016: Shortly after this fact check
   posted, we revised a sentence to say that we didn't find research tying
   the addition of simple bike lanes to specific percentage reductions in
   crashes.

In a statement, the group’s executive director, Mercedes Feris, said:
   "Bike lanes and sidewalks have been proven to reduce crashes by up to 38
   percent on Austin’s streets."

Our ruling

   Bike Austin said: "Bike lanes and sidewalks have been proven to reduce
   crashes by up to 38 percent on Austin’s streets."
